alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 12:56PM EST until February 13 at 11:17AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Cabarrus County in the piedmont of North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM EST, The river level along the Rocky River continued to rise and will likely remain out of it`s banks all afternoon. Flooding of low-lying areas will also linger on select tributaries, especially along Back Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Low lying areas along the Rocky River and select tributaries. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
